title: How to Make Indian Milk Tea

steps.title: Set a metallic saucepan on the stove top or hob.
steps.content: Set a metallic saucepan on the stove top or hob. Pour three quarters of a cup of water into it. Allow the water to boil for a few minutes on a low flame. Then add two teaspoons of tea leaves or powder, continuing to boil on the same flame. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Optionally, add the piece of freshly crushed ginger and four green cardamoms.
steps.content: Optionally, add the piece of freshly crushed ginger and four green cardamoms. [2] X Research source Add the crystallized sugar according to your taste. Simmer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Add quarter cup of milk.
steps.content: Add quarter cup of milk. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the solution from the saucepan to the teacup with the help of a tea strainer.
steps.content: Pour the solution from the saucepan to the teacup with the help of a tea strainer. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Serve the Indian tea hot.
steps.content: Serve the Indian tea hot. If you are creative in garnishing, you can always add a natural tea leaf on the tea before serving. (Do not add more than one, as tea leaves will become intense in taste, which makes the tea taste bitter).
